alert.note: Alert for Allendale (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Screven. Portions of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Allendale. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Allendale, Hiltonia, Sycamore, Ulmer, Burtons Ferry Landing, Martin, Millett, Appleton, Seigling, Millhaven, Hilltonia, Milbury, Averill, Baldock, Allendale County Airport and Bascom.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
